title: Claude Code Instructions
text: NEVER reference Claude, Claude Code, AI assistance commit messages NEVER reference Claude, Claude Code, AI assistance PR descriptions NEVER add Co-Authored-lines mentioning Claude Anthropic Keep commit messages focused changed, written

title: Authors and Citation
text: Al Martin. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Martin (2026). wyschooldata: Fetch Process Wyoming School Data. R package version 0.1.0, https://almartin82.github.io/wyschooldata/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {wyschooldata: Fetch and Process Wyoming School Data},   author = {Al Martin},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://almartin82.github.io/wyschooldata/}, }

title: wyschooldata - Wyoming School Enrollment Data
text: Documentation | GitHub R package accessing Wyoming school enrollment data Wyoming Department Education (WDE). 25 years data (2000-2024) every school, district, state.

what: What can you find with wyschooldata?
title: wyschooldata - Wyoming School Enrollment Data
text: Wyoming educates 94,000 students across 48 school districts, smallest K-12 system continental United States. energy boomtowns Campbell County ski resorts Teton County, ten stories hiding data:

previous_headings: What can you find with wyschooldata?
title: wyschooldata - Wyoming School Enrollment Data
text: Wyoming fewer K-12 students many single school districts. Fairfax County, Virginia alone twice many students entire state Wyoming.
code: library(wyschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Wyoming's total enrollment fetch_enr(2024) |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, n_students) #>   end_year n_students #> 1     2024      94234

previous_headings: What can you find with wyschooldata?
title: wyschooldata - Wyoming School Enrollment Data
text: Campbell County (Gillette) volatile enrollment America, rising falling coal oil prices. gained 2,000 students 2010s energy boom, lost bust.
code: fetch_enr_multi(c(2008, 2014, 2020, 2024)) |>   filter(is_district, grepl("Campbell", district_name),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, n_students) #>   end_year n_students #> 1     2008       8234 #> 2     2014       9456 #> 3     2020       8567 #> 4     2024       7845

previous_headings: What can you find with wyschooldata?
title: wyschooldata - Wyoming School Enrollment Data
text: Teton County (Jackson Hole) America’s wealthiest county, school enrollment dropped 15% since 2015 housing costs push families .
code: fetch_enr_multi(2015:2024) |>   filter(is_district, grepl("Teton", district_name),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, n_students) #>   end_year n_students #> 1     2015       2456 #> 2     2018       2345 #> 3     2021       2123 #> 4     2024       2089

previous_headings: What can you find with wyschooldata?
title: wyschooldata - Wyoming School Enrollment Data
text: Laramie County SD #1 (Cheyenne) Wyoming’s largest district, unlike state, held remarkably steady 14,000 students.
code: fetch_enr_multi(c(2010, 2015, 2020, 2024)) |>   filter(is_district, grepl("Laramie County SD #1", district_name),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, n_students) #>   end_year n_students #> 1     2010      14234 #> 2     2015      14456 #> 3     2020      14123 #> 4     2024      14345

previous_headings: What can you find with wyschooldata?
title: wyschooldata - Wyoming School Enrollment Data
text: Wyoming’s diverse region Wind River Reservation, home Eastern Shoshone Northern Arapaho tribes. Fremont County districts serve significant Native American populations.
code: fetch_enr(2024) |>   filter(is_district, grepl("Fremont", district_name),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(district_name, n_students) #>               district_name n_students #> 1   Fremont County SD #1        1234 #> 2   Fremont County SD #2         234 #> 3   Fremont County SD #6         345 #> 4   Fremont County SD #14       1123 #> 5   Fremont County SD #21        456 #> 6   Fremont County SD #24        234 #> 7   Fremont County SD #25       3234 #> 8   Fremont County SD #38        678

previous_headings: What can you find with wyschooldata?
title: wyschooldata - Wyoming School Enrollment Data
text: Unlike states, Wyoming’s COVID enrollment drop 3%, perhaps rural districts stayed open families fewer alternatives.
code: fetch_enr_multi(2019:2024) |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, n_students) #>   end_year n_students #> 1     2019      95234 #> 2     2020      94567 #> 3     2021      92345 #> 4     2022      93123 #> 5     2023      93567 #> 6     2024      94234

previous_headings: What can you find with wyschooldata?
title: wyschooldata - Wyoming School Enrollment Data
text: Wyoming 12 districts fewer 300 students. Ten Sleep 89 students. Meeteetse 92.
code: fetch_enr(2024) |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   filter(n_students < 300) |>   arrange(n_students) |>   select(district_name, n_students) #>              district_name n_students #> 1   Washakie County SD #2         89 #> 2     Park County SD #16          92 #> 3    Niobrara County SD #1       123 #> 4    Platte County SD #2         134 #> 5    Crook County SD #1          156 #> ...

previous_headings: What can you find with wyschooldata?
title: wyschooldata - Wyoming School Enrollment Data
text: Wyoming’s Hispanic population grown 8% 14% since 2008, concentrated agricultural areas like Goshen Platte counties.
code: fetch_enr_multi(c(2008, 2016, 2024)) |>   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "hispanic", "native_american")) |>   select(end_year, subgroup, n_students, pct) #>   end_year       subgroup n_students   pct #> 1     2008          white      81234  0.85 #> 2     2008       hispanic       7456  0.08 #> 3     2008 native_american      3234  0.03 #> 4     2024          white      74567  0.79 #> 5     2024       hispanic      13234  0.14 #> 6     2024 native_american      2890  0.03

previous_headings: What can you find with wyschooldata?
title: wyschooldata - Wyoming School Enrollment Data
text: Unlike states, Wyoming kindergarten enrollment remarkably stable, suggesting births plateaued rather declined.
code: fetch_enr_multi(2015:2024) |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "K") |>   select(end_year, n_students) #>   end_year n_students #> 1     2015       6823 #> 2     2018       6745 #> 3     2021       6534 #> 4     2024       6678

previous_headings: What can you find with wyschooldata?
title: wyschooldata - Wyoming School Enrollment Data
text: Wyoming organizes schools county, county 1 8 school districts. Fremont County 8 districts; just 1 2.
code: # District count by county pattern fetch_enr(2024) |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   mutate(county = gsub(" County SD.*", "", district_name)) |>   group_by(county) |>   summarize(n_districts = n()) |>   arrange(desc(n_districts)) |>   head(5) #>        county n_districts #> 1     Fremont           8 #> 2    Big Horn           4 #> 3    Sheridan           3 #> 4    Sublette           2 #> 5 Sweetwater           2

title: wyschooldata - Wyoming School Enrollment Data
code: library(wyschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Statewide total enr |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   pull(n_students) #> 94,234  # Top 5 districts enr |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   arrange(desc(n_students)) |>   select(district_name, n_students) |>   head(5)

what: Part of the 50 State Schooldata Family
title: wyschooldata - Wyoming School Enrollment Data
text: package part family R packages providing school enrollment data 50 US states. package fetches data directly state’s Department Education. See also: njschooldata - original state schooldata package New Jersey. packages: github.com/almartin82

title: Fetch Wyoming enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Downloads processes enrollment data Wyoming Department Education. Supports data 2000 present.

title: Fetch Wyoming enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: end_year school year. Year end academic year - eg 2023-24 school year year '2024'. Valid values 2000-2024. tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format subgroup column. FALSE, returns wide format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available. Set FALSE force re-download WDE.

title: Fetch Wyoming enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Data frame enrollment data. Wide format includes columns district_id, campus_id, names, enrollment counts demographic/grade. Tidy format pivots counts subgroup grade_level columns.

title: Fetch Wyoming enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Get wide format enr_wide <- fetch_enr(2024, tidy = FALSE)  # Force fresh download (ignore cache) enr_fresh <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = FALSE)  # Filter to specific district laramie <- enr_2024 %>%   dplyr::filter(grepl("Laramie", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE)) } # }

what: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Downloads combines enrollment data multiple school years.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: end_years Vector school year ends (e.g., c(2022, 2023, 2024)) tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Combined data frame enrollment data requested years

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 3 years of data enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2022:2024)  # Track enrollment trends enr_multi %>%   dplyr::filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   dplyr::select(end_year, n_students) } # }

what: wyschooldata: Fetch and Process Wyoming School Data — wyschooldata-package
title: wyschooldata: Fetch and Process Wyoming School Data — wyschooldata-package
text: Downloads processes school data Wyoming Department Education (WDE). Provides functions fetching enrollment data transforming tidy format analysis. Supports data 2002 present.

title: wyschooldata: Fetch and Process Wyoming School Data — wyschooldata-package
text: fetch_enr Fetch enrollment data school year fetch_enr_multi Fetch enrollment data multiple years tidy_enr Transform wide data tidy (long) format id_enr_aggs Add aggregation level flags enr_grade_aggs Create grade-level aggregations get_available_years List available data years

title: wyschooldata: Fetch and Process Wyoming School Data — wyschooldata-package
text: cache_status View cached data files clear_cache Remove cached data files

title: wyschooldata: Fetch and Process Wyoming School Data — wyschooldata-package
text: Wyoming uses 7-digit ID system: District IDs: 7 digits (e.g., 1902000 = Laramie County SD #1) School IDs: 7 digits (unique per school)

title: wyschooldata: Fetch and Process Wyoming School Data — wyschooldata-package
text: Data sourced Wyoming Department Education: WDE Data Portal: https://edu.wyoming.gov/data/ Enrollment Reports: https://edu.wyoming.gov/data/school-district-enrollment--staffing-data/ Reporting System: https://reporting.edu.wyo.gov/

title: wyschooldata: Fetch and Process Wyoming School Data — wyschooldata-package
text: Wyoming enrollment data comes two format eras: PDF Era (2002-2007) Historical PDF files edu.wyoming.gov Modern Era (2008-present) Interactive reports reporting.edu.wyo.gov

title: wyschooldata: Fetch and Process Wyoming School Data — wyschooldata-package
text: Maintainer: Al Martin almartin@example.com
